definition: swindler/itinerant con-man
river/CL:條|条[tiao2],道[dao4]
surname Jiang
lake/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The charlatan boasted that he could charm off any disease.
sentences.chinese: 这个江湖骗子吹牛说他能用符咒治好各种疾病。

sentences.english: The quack was stormed with questions .
sentences.chinese: 江湖骗子受到了猛烈的质问。

sentences.english: In the meantime, most orchid still is bold-faced charlatan and swindler.
sentences.chinese: 同时，大多数兰花还是厚颜无耻的吹牛者和江湖骗子。

definition: to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
lit. dress up as God, play the devil (idiom); fig. to mystify/to deceive people/to scam
sorcerer
quack/charlatan
to swindle/to cheat
lit. devil's gate, crooked path (idiom); corrupt practices/crooked methods/dishonesty
to make a living as a traveling performer etc
dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
fortune telling
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
to cheat sb/a scam
lit. to wave a banner as if it were a tiger skin (idiom)/fig. to borrow sb's prestige/to take the name of a great cause as a shield

definition: (coll.) quack (doctor)/charlatan
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
